Title: Inequality: $(a^3+a+1)(b^3+b+1)(c^3+c+1) \leq 27$
Content:
Let be $a,b,c \geq 0$ such that: $a^2+b^2+c^2=3$. Prove that: 
  $$(a^3+a+1)(b^3+b+1)(c^3+c+1) \leq 27.$$ I try to apply $GM \leq AM$ for $x=a^3+a+1$, $y=b^3+b+1,z=c^3+c+1$ and 
$$\displaystyle \sqrt[3]{xyz} \leq \frac{x+y+z}{3}$$ but still nothing. Thanks :-)
